name: Sex, Gender and Work
description: This course will look at the situation faced by women in the workplace and workforce, and the implications for male employees. We will focus on classic and current research, theory and debates about sex segregation in jobs and occupations, the wage and earnings gap, and access to and exercise of authority by women in management positions. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC221H5, 231H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 200 level
